prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
For API Iterator.next, the API usage rule is: Get the next element from an Iterator if it has more elements.

Question: Adding Objects To Linked List Using Iterator: :Ok , Im trying to add some student object in to a Linked List, But im not allowed to use the .add method of Linked list, So when the user calls the removeStudent Method they enter the sutdents ID number in, Then it checks the List for an Object with that ArrayHeres My Code For the Add Method:public void deleteStudent(int studentID){    while (iter.hasNext())    {       Student ob = iter.next();       if (ob.getStudentID() == studentID)       {         iter.remove();         break;       }     }  }When i run this i get this error:Exception in thread "main" java.util.ConcurrentModificationException    at java.util.LinkedList$ListItr.checkForComodification(LinkedList.java:953)    at java.util.LinkedList$ListItr.next(LinkedList.java:886)    at student.Registry.deleteStudent(Registry.java:30)    at student.Registry.main(Registry.java:51)Java Result: 1
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: The code you provided is missing the initialization of the Iterator. To use the Iterator, you need to initialize it with the LinkedList using the iterator() method. Here's the updated code:

public void deleteStudent(int studentID) {
    Iterator<Student> iter = linkedList.iterator();
    while (iter.hasNext()) {
        Student ob = iter.next();
        if (ob.getStudentID() == studentID) {
            iter.remove();
            break;
        }
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: The error you are getting, java.util.ConcurrentModificationException, occurs when you try to modify a collection while iterating over it using an Iterator. In your code, it seems that you are modifying the LinkedList by removing an element using iter.remove(), but you haven't initialized the Iterator properly. To fix this, you need to initialize the Iterator using the iterator() method of the LinkedList.

message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: The code you provided is missing the initialization of the Iterator. To use the Iterator, you need to initialize it with the LinkedList using the iterator() method. Here's the updated code:

public void deleteStudent(int studentID) {
    Iterator<Student> iter = linkedList.iterator();
    while (iter.hasNext()) {
        Student ob = iter.next();
        if (ob.getStudentID() == studentID) {
            iter.remove();
            break;
        }
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: The error you are getting, java.util.ConcurrentModificationException, occurs when you try to modify a collection while iterating over it using an Iterator. In your code, it seems that you are modifying the LinkedList by removing an element using iter.remove(), but you haven't initialized the Iterator properly. To fix this, you need to initialize the Iterator using the iterator() method of the LinkedList.
